page.title: 04THE ROMAN CAMP,TADMARTON
page.content: THE ROMAN CAMP IS HALF ON USHERCOMBE FARM AND HALF ON THE TADMARTON HEATH GOLF COURSE. ALL THAT CAN BE SEEN NOW IS A SEMI- CIRCLE RIDGE WITH WHITE STONES AROUND IT. IT IS BELIEVED THAT ANCIENT BATTLES WERE FOUGHT THERE AS ARROWHEADS AND KNIVES HAVE BEEN FOUND AND THE BATTLE OF WIGGINTON HILL WAS FOUGHT ONLY 2 KM. AWAY. THERE IS A WELL UNDER A HEDGE IN THE FORT. WHEN THE FARMER FROM USHERCOMBE FARM WAS PLOUGHING THE AREA,(THEY ARE ONLY ALLOWED TO PLOUGH 2-3 FEET DEEP),THEY FOUND 2 SKELETONS. ONE WAS JUST A SKULL WITH AN ALMOST PERFECT SET OF TEETH (ONLY ONE AT THE VERY FRONT WAS MISSING). THEY WERE TOLD THAT THESE SKELETONS WERE MALES AND HAD BEEN HIT OVER THE HEAD, PROBABLY WHILE DRINKING AT THE WELL. PART OF THE CAMP IS UNDER THE LOCAL GOLF COURSE AND SO WILL NOT BE ABLE TO BE STUDIED FOR MANY YEARS.
